channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NE
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NE

item.title: Report E-2023090172
item.description:
Report E-2023090172

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: AURORA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon bladder filled box of 184 stripper (un1760) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 2 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023090088
item.description:
Report E-2023090088

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: HASTINGS
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 29, 2023, at 1239 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Hastings, Nebraska regarding the release of approximately (0.5) gallons of PT-130 (Ferric Sulfate 60%) Corrosive Liquid, Acidic, Inorganic, N.O.S. (UN3264, 8, III) from (1) IBC Tote. The release was reportedly due to a loose nozzle and contained to the trailer floor. Contractors cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55- gallon poly drum and taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023080432
item.description:
Report X-2023080432

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: BEATRICE
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE ON ROLLERS, PRELOADER NOTICED BOTTOM NEEDED TAPE. THEN NOTICED WAS FLAMMABLE LIQUID AND HAD EVAPORATED RESIDUE ON BOX. CALLED FOR DESIGNATED RESPONDER. RESPONDER PROCESSED LEAKING HAZMAT THROUGH DMP.
